Summary:

Add .uk-align-center to images less than 740px.

for (let i=0; i < images.length; i++) {
     if (images[i].style.width < minWidth) 
         images[i].classList.add('uk-align-center');
}

fixBrokenHrefs() Method

Summary:

Fixing href attribute value issues.

Source:
src/static/js/main.js, line 273

Regex array to remove some chars from the buildRec() nav that breaks the windows scrolling behavior.

let regexMatch = /(-)$/g;
let links = document.querySelectorAll('.uk-nav a');

for (let i=0; i < links.length; i++) {
     if (links[i].getAttribute('href').match(regexMatch)) {
         let href = links[i].getAttribute('href');
         let newHref = href.substr(
             0, href.lastIndexOf('-', href.length - 1)
         );
         links[i].setAttribute('href', newHref);
     }
}

makeUIkitTables() Method

Summary:

Add uk-table classes to markdown tables

Source:
src/static/js/main.js, line 419 
let tables = document.getElementsByTagName('table');
for (let i=0; i < tables.length; i++) {
     if (!tables[i].classList.contains('uk-table')) {
         tables[i].classList.add(
             'uk-table',
             'uk-table-small',
             'uk-table-striped',
             'uk-table-middle',
             'uk-table-responsive'
         );
     }
}

module:strings/format(format, …args) → {string} Method

Source:
src/fixtures/strings/format.js, line 24
Returns:

Format a string quickly and easily using .net style format strings

Examples
var strings = require("papyrus/strings");
var s = strings.format("Hello {0}", "Madame Vastra");
// s = "Hello Madame Vastra"
{@lang xml}
<span>
     <%= strings.format("Hello {0}", "Madame Vastra") %>
</span>
Parameters
Name Type Attributes Description
format string

A string format like "Hello {0}, now take off your {1}!"
args ? <repeatable>

One argument per {} in the string, positionally replaced

Settings

Code Ligatures

Typographic ligatures are when multiple characters appear to combine into a single character. Simplistically, when you type two or more characters & they magically attach to each other, you're using ligatures that were supported by your OS, your app, and your font.

Light Themes
